info.title: TáComQuem API
info.description: API para gestão de empréstimos pessoais entre amigos

get.description: Health check endpoint
Database health check endpoint

post.description: Register a new user with email and password
Verify email address with token sent via email
Reset password with token from email
Refresh access token using refresh token

get.description: Get current authenticated user
List all items owned by the current user
Get a specific item by ID

post.description: Upload up to 5 images (max 10MB each). Images are auto-compressed to WebP. Accepted formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, HEIC, TIFF.
Create a new loan and generate a confirmation link

get.description: List all loans for the authenticated user
List completed loans (returned/cancelled) with direction filter and tab counts
Get loan details

post.description: Send a reminder for a loan

get.description: Get public loan information via token (no authentication required)

post.description: Confirm a loan by token (requires authentication)

get.description: Get dashboard data for the authenticated user
Get list of friends for the authenticated user
Performs a scoped search for the authenticated user across active owned items and known friends.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search term for items and friends

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results per group (items and friends), between 1 and 20

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of notifications for the authenticated user.
Use the `read` filter to show only unread (`false`) or already-read (`true`) notifications.
The `unreadCount` field always reflects the total number of unread notifications regardless
of the current filter — use it to display the notification badge count in the UI.

parameters.name: read
parameters.description: Filter by read status. Omit to return all notifications

200.description: Paginated list of notifications with unread count

loanId.description: Associated loan ID, null if not linked to a loan

title.description: Short heading displayed in the notification card

read.description: Whether the user has read this notification

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the notification was created

sentAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the push/email was dispatched, null if not yet sent

notifications.description: Ordered list of notifications, newest first

unreadCount.description: Total unread notifications for this user (ignores active read filter)

schema.description: Paginated list of notifications with unread count

patch.description:
Marks a single notification as read for the authenticated user.
This operation is idempotent - calling it on an already-read notification will succeed
without changes. Users can only mark their own notifications as read.

Marks all unread notifications for the authenticated user as read in a single operation.
Useful for "Mark all as read" functionality in notification centers. Returns the count
of notifications that were actually marked as read.

markedCount.description: Number of notifications marked as read

delete.description:
Permanently deletes a notification for the authenticated user.
Users can only delete their own notifications. This operation cannot be undone.
